docs.snippet: Disgruntled Arsenal fans have stoked up the pressure on under-fire manager Arsene Wenger by telling the club's board it would be 'inappropriate' to offer the Frenchman a new contract.
docs.lead_paragraph: Disgruntled Arsenal fans have stoked up the pressure on under-fire manager Arsene Wenger by telling the club's board it would be 'inappropriate' to offer the Frenchman a new contract.

headline.main: Arsenal Fans Call on Club to Halt Wenger Contract Talks

docs.snippet: While she appreciates the opportunity to see the world, a longtime business traveler would rather be at home.
docs.lead_paragraph: While she appreciates the opportunity to see the world, a longtime business traveler would rather be at home.
docs.abstract: Frequent Flier column features Forward Options chief Karen Elizaga discussing her flying experiences.

headline.main: Travel Is Great, but There’s No Place Like Home
headline.print_headline: Travel Is Great, but There’s No Place Like Home

docs.snippet: Currently, 2.7 billion people use the Internet, or 39 percent of the world’s population. Europe has the highest use, followed by the Americas, but in Africa, only 16 percent use it, half of the rates of Asia and the Pacific.
docs.lead_paragraph: Currently, 2.7 billion people use the Internet, or 39 percent of the world’s population. Europe has the highest use, followed by the Americas, but in Africa, only 16 percent use it, half of the rates of Asia and the Pacific.

docs.snippet: Arsenal's Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will be out for at least six weeks with a knee injury, manager Arsene Wenger said on Tuesday, easing fears the England winger could be set for an even longer spell on the sidelines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arsenal's Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will be out for at least six weeks with a knee injury, manager Arsene Wenger said on Tuesday, easing fears the England winger could be set for an even longer spell on the sidelines.

headline.main: Arsenal's Oxlade-Chamberlain Out for Six Weeks

docs.snippet: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon recommended a 15 percent reduction in the number of U.N. troops in Haiti on Tuesday and an examination of whether the beleaguered peacekeeping operation remains the best way to support to the impoverished Caribbean...
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon recommended a 15 percent reduction in the number of U.N. troops in Haiti on Tuesday and an examination of whether the beleaguered peacekeeping operation remains the best way to support to the impoverished Caribbean nation.

headline.main: UN Chief Proposes Reduction in Force in Haiti
headline.print_headline: UN Chief Proposes Reduction in Force in Haiti

docs.snippet: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger defended his transfer policy on Tuesday, reminding disgruntled fans of the club's past successes and encouraging them to put their faith in the current squad.

docs.snippet: Uruguay may soon become the first country in the world to fully regulate the production, sale and distribution of marijuana.

docs.snippet: A U.S. trade proposal aimed at eliminating foreign tariffs on U.S. tobacco products while preserving the right of governments to adopt anti-smoking regulations is drawing fire from opposing sides - public health and business groups.
